TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ContentType extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A class representing a Content-Type header value.
Docs.remarks: The Content-Type header is a way for the originating client to suggest to the receiving client the mime-type of the content and, depending on that mime-type, presentation options such as charset.

MemberSignature.Value: public ContentType (string mediaType, string mediaSubtype);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string mediaType, string mediaSubtype) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: Creates a new based on the media type and subtype provided.

exception.para: is empty or contains invalid characters.
is empty or contains invalid characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Boundary { get; set; }
.property instance string Boundary

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the boundary parameter.
Docs.remarks: This is a special parameter on entities, designating to the parser a unique string that should be considered the boundary marker for each sub-part.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Charset { get; set; }
.property instance string Charset

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the charset parameter.
Docs.remarks: Text-based entities will often include a charset parameter so that the receiving client can properly render the text.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Matches (string mediaType, string mediaSubtype);
.method public hidebysig instance bool Matches(string mediaType, string mediaSubtype) cil managed

Docs.summary: Checks if the this instance of matches the specified media type and subtype.
Docs.returns: true if the matches the provided media type and subtype.
Docs.remarks: If the specified or are "*", they match anything.

MemberSignature.Value: public string MediaSubtype { get; set; }
.property instance string MediaSubtype

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the media subtype.
Docs.remarks: Represents the media subtype of the . Examples include "html", "jpeg", and "octet-stream". This string should always be treated as case-insensitive.
Docs.exception: is empty or contains invalid characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public string MediaType { get; set; }
.property instance string MediaType

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of the media.
Docs.remarks: Represents the media type of the . Examples include "text", "image", and "application". This string should always be treated as case-insensitive.
Docs.exception: is empty or contains invalid characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public string MimeType { get; }
.property instance string MimeType

Docs.summary: Gets the simple mime-type.
Docs.remarks: Gets the simple mime-type.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Name { get; set; }
.property instance string Name

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name parameter.
Docs.remarks: The name parameter is a way for the originiating client to suggest to the receiving client a display-name for the content, which may be used by the receiving client if it cannot display the actual content to the user.

MemberSignature.Value: public MimeKit.ParameterList Parameters { get; }
.property instance class MimeKit.ParameterList Parameters

Docs.summary: Gets the parameters.
Docs.remarks: In addition to the media type and subtype, the Content-Type header may also contain parameters to provide further hints to the receiving client as to how to process or display the content.
